content.rendered:
The University of La Verne Sustainable Campus Consortium is committed to supporting the University’s mission statement by promoting proactive, environmentally responsible practices throughout all campus activities.

The Consortium seeks to raise community-wide awareness and understanding of environmental issues and the responsibilities each person has to help address these issues. The Consortium will create a framework for ecologically sound, socially and fiscally feasible practices across campus and will provide encouragement and direction to students, staff, faculty, and the entire campus for implementation of these practices.

The Consortium was created in March 2002 with the purpose of educating the University community about sustainable practices, assessing the sustainability of the campus as it is now, and suggesting ways to improve conservation and environmentally sound practices across campus. The Consortium is made up of representatives from across campus, including faculty and staff.
